result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Santos Garcia Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes: In the event Defendant satisfies condition, State will move dismiss Count 1.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time work, school or combination of the two. Complete high school or obtain a GED/HSED.

Commit no further law violations during the period of this agreement. Have no contact with J.L.D., dob 2/13/99. Defendant understands that "no contact" means no direct or indirect contact, whether in person, by phone, or by mail, and whether initiated by the defendant or by someone on the defendant's behalf. The only exceptions to this condition will be for contact as required by any mediation agreement, counseling or a letter of apology required by this DAGPA. Consume no alcohol beverages or controlled substances. No entry into bars or taverns. Not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not drive any motor vehicle unless or until his/her license has been reinstated.

Take any/all medicines prescribed to the defendant by a licensed physician. Defendant shall comply with any and all rules of juvenile supervision and probation and successfully complete any term of probation ordered as a part of this case. Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office.  Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted.  This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment.

Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment and/or school. Obtain GED or HSED.
No contact direct or indirect with JLD.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Write minimum 250 word apology letter to parents of JLD.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.
Perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service for a non-profit agency.

records.addlTxt: No longer needed

Defendant Santos Garcia in court with attorney Aileen Henry. Defendant Santos Garcia in custody. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews DAGPA, State's Motion to revoke. State advises of plea agrement. Discussion regarding timeline of DAGPA. Defense believes that if there's no ruling extending the DAGPA, the agreement was expired. Further discussion regarding timeline. State moves to dismiss. Defense has no objection. Court dismisses case.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 30, 2018 at 04:00 pm.
from Defense requesting rescheduling. Per Court, Granted.

Defendant Santos Garcia in court with attorney Aileen Henry. Defendant Santos Garcia in custody. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense thinks cases will resolve, requests hearing in about 30 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2018 at 01:50 pm.

Defendant Santos Garcia appears by video. Attorney Tara L. Teesch appears in person.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Teesch indicates defendant qualifies for PD representation, unsure if she or another SPD atty will be representing defendant. Court reviews events in file, quashes warrant.  State intends to file motion to revoke deferred agreement, requests signature bond be converted to a cash bond. Atty Teesch gives bond argument. Bond set. Status scheduled for 1/08/18 at 10:00 am., Br. 2.

Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement
for DNA Sample

Defendant Santos Garcia in court with attorney Brian David Van Ells. Defendant Santos Garcia in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas on Counts 2 and 3, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2 and 3. Court reviews collateral consequences of possible felony conviction, possible penalties. Court finds basis to accept plea on Count 1, withholds acceptance of plea, reviews conditions contained within DAGPA, accepts DAGPA.   State/Defense make sentencing recommendations. Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 18, 2017 at 10:00 am.
to Transport

Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas, advises of settlement offer received from State. Status conference set for September 14, 2015 at 4:00.
by State

Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Video conference confirmed with Lincoln Hills for 7/27/15 at 3:45
